content: b'Something I explained to 13 yo: There is no intrinsically fair price for any commodity, just the market price. Most people have no problem understanding that. Until the commodity is labor. Then suddenly it becomes hard to understand.'

b"If you design your startup to appeal to investors instead of users, you may well succeed in raising your first round. But when you try to raise your second, without good growth numbers, you'll suddenly find you're not appealing to investors after all."
